netaddr
 
[frames] | no frames]
[ Module Hierarchy | Class Hierarchy ]

Class Hierarchy

  • object: The most base type
    • netaddr.address.Addr: The base class containing common functionality for all subclasses representing various network address types.
      • netaddr.address.EUI: EUI objects represent IEEE Extended Unique Identifiers.
      • netaddr.address.IP: A class whose objects represent Internet Protocol network addresses.
    • netaddr.address.AddrRange: A block of contiguous network addresses bounded by an arbitrary start and stop address.
      • netaddr.address.CIDR: A block of contiguous IPv4 or IPv6 network addresses defined by a base network address and a bitmask prefix or subnet mask address indicating the size/extent of the subnet.
      • netaddr.address.Wildcard: A block of contiguous IPv4 network addresses defined using a wildcard style syntax.
    • netaddr.strategy.AddrStrategy: Very basic support for all common operations performed on each network type.
      • netaddr.strategy.EUI48Strategy: Implements the operations that can be performed on an IEEE 48-bit EUI (Extended Unique Identifer).
      • netaddr.strategy.IPv4Strategy: An optimised AddrStrategy for IPv4 addresses.
      • netaddr.strategy.IPv6Strategy: Implements the operations that can be performed on an Internet Protocol version 6 network address in accordance with RFC 4291.
    • exceptions.BaseException: Common base class for all exceptions
      • exceptions.Exception: Common base class for all non-exit exceptions.
        • netaddr.AddrConversionError: Conversion between address types or notations failed.
        • netaddr.AddrFormatError: Network address format not recognised.
